column4: Identification number assigned to a jurisdiction (province, territory, Canada)

column5: English name of jurisdiction (province, territory, Canada)
French name of jurisdiction (province, territory, Canada)

column4: Number assigned to each epidemiologic week in a calendar year, based on the Fluwatch weeks calendar

column10: Total number of cases during the reporting week for a jurisdiction, minus the total number of cases from that jurisdiction's previous week's update.

column3: The total number of cases for a jurisdiction divided by the population of that jurisdiction [(totalcases/population) x 100,000]

column10: Total number of deaths for a jurisdiction, minus the total number of deaths from that jurisdiction's previous week's update.

column3: The total number of deaths for a jurisdiction divided by the population of that jurisdiction, multiplied by 100,000 [(numdeaths/population) x 100,000]

column2: Case rate in the reporting week per 100,000 population
column3: The number of cases reported over the last reporting week for a jurisdiction, divided by the population of that jurisdiction, multiplied by 100,000 [(numtotal_last7/population) x 100,000]

column2: Death rate in the reporting week per 100,000 population
column3: The number of deaths reported over the last reporting week in a jurisdiction, divided by the population of that jurisdiction, multiplied by 100,000 [(numdeaths_last7 /population) x 100,000]

column2: Case rate in last 2 reporting weeks per 100,000 population
column3: The number of cases reported over the last 2 reporting weeks in a jurisdiction, divided by the population of that jurisdiction, multiplied by 100,000 [(numtotal_last14/population) x 100,000]

column2: Death rate in last 2 weeks per 100,000 population
column3: The number deaths reported over the last 2 reporting weeks in a jurisdiction, divided by the population of that jurisdiction, multiplied by 100,000  [(numdeaths_last14/population) x 100,000]

column11: The number of cases reported over the reporting week in a jurisdiction, divided by 7 days

column2: Average daily cases reported over the last reporting week per 100,000 population
column3: The number of cases reported over the reporting week in a jurisdiction, divided by 7 days, divided by the population of that jurisdiction, multiplied by 100,000  [(avgcases_last7/population) x 100,000]

column11: The number of deaths reported over the reporting week in a jurisdiction, divided by 7 days

column2: Average daily deaths reported over the last reporting week per 100,000
column3: The number of deaths reported over the reporting week in a jurisdiction, divided by 7 days, multiplied by 100,000 [(avgdeaths_last7/population) x 100,000]

column1: 3) This information is based on data published by our provincial and territorial partners on cases, and deaths.

For the most up to date data for any province, territory or city, please visit their website. The number of cases or deaths reported in any week may differ slightly from those on the provincial and territorial websites.
5) When a jurisdiction reports weekly, but not by epidemiological week, the cases and/or deaths are distributed evenly over the week represented in the provincial/territorial report.
This is because provinces and territories may go back and update their case and death counts as new information becomes available.
This dataset uses current provincial/territorial reporting practices to calculate all historic and current case and death counts.

6) When a jurisdiction does not report by day or week, weekly counts are not calculated for that jurisdiction. If available, in the provincial/territorial report, counts for the last 2 reporting weeks are incorporated.
